summaryText: In this powerful message about walking under the influence of the Holy Spirit, Scott Williams delivers an incredible sermon that challenges believers to live differently! Using the analogy of air traffic control guiding a plane safely, Pastor Scott illustrates how the Holy Spirit wants to guide us through life's turbulent moments. Drawing from Galatians 5, he breaks down what it means to truly be 'under the influence' of the Spirit using the memorable acronym WALK: Walk Different, Act Different, Live Different, and Know Different. Just like getting drunk takes repeated drinking, walking in the Spirit requires consistent spiritual 'intake'. Pastor Scott reminds us that the Holy Spirit isn't some mystical force, but a loving guide wanting to help us navigate life's challenges safely. The message culminates in a powerful altar call where multiple people surrender their lives to Christ, proving that when we tune into the Holy Spirit's frequency, transformative moments can happen! The key takeaway? It's not about being perfect, but being intentional about listening and responding to God's gentle nudges.
mainPoints: Walk under the influence of the Holy Spirit
The Holy Spirit guides us like air traffic control guides a plane
Our daily choices determine whether we follow the flesh or the Spirit

versesMentioned.text: So I say, walk by the Spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of the flesh. For the flesh desires what is contrary to the Spirit, and the Spirit what is contrary to the flesh. They are in conflict with each other, so that you are not to do whatever you want. But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law. The acts of the flesh are obvious: sexual immorality, impurity and debauchery; idolatry and witchcraft; hatred, discord, jealousy, fits of rage, selfish ambition, dissensions, factions and envy; drunkenness, orgies, and the like. I warn you, as I did before, that those who live like this will not inherit the kingdom of God. But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, forbearance, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness and self-control. Against such things there is no law. Those who belong to Christ Jesus have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires. Since we live by the Spirit, let us keep in step with the Spirit.

Monday.scripture: Ephesians 5:18: 'Do not get drunk on wine, which leads to debauchery. Instead, be filled with the Spirit.'
Monday.focus: Understanding spiritual filling vs. worldly numbing
Monday.action: Identify one area in your life where you're using something to numb pain instead of turning to the Holy Spirit. Journal about this and pray for guidance.
Monday.prayer: Holy Spirit, reveal the areas where I'm seeking comfort outside of You. Help me to turn to You first in moments of pain or confusion. Fill me with Your presence and peace. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Romans 8:5: 'Those who live according to the flesh have their minds set on what the flesh desires; but those who live in accordance with the Spirit have their minds set on what the Spirit desires.'
Tuesday.focus: Intentionally setting your mind on spiritual things
Tuesday.action: Create a playlist of worship music. Listen to it throughout the day, using each song as a moment to refocus on God's presence.
Tuesday.prayer: Lord, help me shift my focus from worldly distractions to Your divine perspective. Train my mind to think about Your things, not just my own desires. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Galatians 5:25: 'Since we live by the Spirit, let us keep in step with the Spirit.'
Wednesday.action: Pause three times today when you feel a 'nudge' from the Holy Spirit. Write down what you sense God might be saying and how you can respond.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, make me sensitive to Your voice. Help me to recognize and quickly respond to Your gentle guidance. Give me courage to act on Your promptings. Amen.

Thursday.action: Reflect on recent times you might have ignored or resisted the Holy Spirit's guidance. Confess these moments and recommit to obedience.
Thursday.prayer: Holy Spirit, forgive me for the times I've ignored Your leading. Soften my heart and make me willing to follow Your guidance, no matter the cost. Amen.

Friday.scripture: John 16:13: 'But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all the truth.'
Friday.action: Make a decision today by specifically asking the Holy Spirit for wisdom, then wait and listen before acting.
Friday.prayer: God, I trust Your guidance more than my own understanding. Spirit of Truth, lead me clearly today. Help me to discern Your voice above all others. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Zechariah 4:6: ''Not by might nor by power, but by my Spirit,' says the Lord Almighty.'
Saturday.focus: Recognizing spiritual power over human effort
Saturday.action: Identify an area of struggle in your life. Instead of trying to solve it through your own strength, spend extended time in prayer surrendering it to the Holy Spirit.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, I surrender my own efforts and rely on Your Spirit's power. Where I am weak, You are strong. Fill me, guide me, empower me. Have Your way in my life. Amen.
